Reason: The configuration option 'gc_log_threshold_in_ms' is classified as performance-sensitive. This is because the configuration directly impacts system performance by affecting the amount of logging generated during Garbage Collection events. Setting a lower threshold may lead to more frequent logging, resulting in increased I/O operations and log processing, which can have a notable performance impact at the system level. Additionally, the code context reveals that the configuration involves operations related to managing Garbage Collector MXBeans, which are time-expensive and memory-expensive operations, further supporting its classification as performance-sensitive.
